item.title: Report X-2024081596
item.description:
Report X-2024081596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PD 7 SUPERVISOR CALLED WITH A LEAKER OUTSIDE OF DOOR 175, RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND DECISION TREE THE PACKAGE WAS SITTING UP RIGHT ON THE CATWALK OF DOOR 175 WITH ONE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE WET FROM INTERNAL LEAKING. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND RETURNED IT TO DMP. WHERE IT WAS DISCOVERED THE LID ON ONE OF THE FOUR 1 GALLON CONTAINERS INSIDE WAS LOOSE AND LEAKING IN THE BAG. WHICH INTURN WAS SATRURATING THE OUTER CARDBOARD BOX AND CAUSING IT TO FAIL. THE FOUR GALLONS WERE THEN PLACED IN A GENEROUS LAYER OF ZEPZORB AND SUBMITTED AS A LIQUID SINCE WE HAD OVER 3 GALLONS OF LIQUID.

item.title: Report X-2024081307
item.description:
Report X-2024081307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A PUNGENT ODOR BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-D. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND SATURATE THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A SINGLE CURROGATED DIVIDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2024081161
item.description:
Report X-2024081161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A pallet with 3 drums loaded onto it collapsed while in transit to service center 003. When the pallet collapsed, the drums were jostled and one of the drums leaked approximately 1 cup of material from the cap on top of the drum. The material pooled on top of the drum but a small amount also got ont o the trailer floor. CURA was contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024081248
item.description:
Report X-2024081248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).
